lines.text: [repeated line]
Don't call me babe!
[an Asian stripper asks Barb a question in French]

[not understanding]
Come again?

[to Barb]
She's Chinese.
Colonel Pryzer. Alexander Willis, Director of Police Operations. Welcome to Steel Harbor.

Wipe that smile off your face, Willis! This burned-out hellhole is the last place on Earth I want to be right now. And if it wasn't for your almost complete incompetence, I wouldn't be here in the first place. Would I?
Yes, well needless to say I intended to have both Krebs and Cora D extraditcated and sent back to Washington by now. However, due to circumstances...

[interupting]
Listen carefully, if Cora D escapes, I will personally rip your heart out of your ass and stuff it back down your throat!

[sarcastic]
That's not very sanitary.
What are you doing here?

[holds up a cigarette]
Looking for a light. Got one?

[laughing]
I don't smoke.
[Barb shoots him in the head with a mini-dart from the fake cigarette]
Neither do I.
[last lines]
Where will you go now, Barb?
Well, I hear Paris is nice this time of year.
Mind if I tag along with you?
Don't mind.
I do believe I'm falling in love.
Get in line!
Add it to my tab, Miss Kopetski. Boom boom boom!
Barbara Kopetski died in the war. I'm Barb Wire.
[Col. Pryzer is torturing Charlie with electric shocks]
One last chance, Charlie. Where are the rental lenses?

[defiant]
The Easter Bunny took 'em!
[Charlie is hit with more electric shocks and he screams in pain]

[in agony]
Please... stop! I'll talk! This guy has them. I gave the lenses to this guy.
What guy?
This big guy. He's big and fat. He has a white beard, he wears a red suite, he lives at the North Pole... and he goes by the name of Kringle. Kris... Kringle.
[moans]
Why don't we start again? From the beginning.
I told you. I told you everything I know. I told you.
[Mind scan up on screen one]
[Image is present. Image is recording]
Citizen, I... uh, I abhor torture. But your words just don't match your thoughts. There are too many details you're just not sharing with us. Our little mind-reading device doesn't lie.
[groans]
[Reset sensors. Go]
Now, where's Dr Corrina Devonshire?
You'll never find her.
You're so beautiful. I'm sorry.
[electrocutes her to death]
What happened to "Barb doesn't take sides"?
Keep it to yourself.
You don't have to buy me a drink, Axel. I'm tight with the management here. You've got a lot of nerve coming in here.
I had no choice. Where's Barb?
I don't think talking to Barb's going to be such a good idea. She took what went on in Seattle a lot better then I did.
I need her help, Charlie. I need her to put me in touch with the local resistance.
Haven't you heard? Barb's retired. Leave... now... before Barb sees you. There's no telling what she might do.
[Axel sees Barb across the room who also sees him and she starts to walk towards him with an angry look on her face]
Too late.
Three... two...
Hello, Barb.
One!
[Barb walk up and puches Axel in the face; Charlie laughs]
Now, where is Dr. Corrina Devonshire?

[the Woman in Torture Room turns her head aside and is panting. Colonel Pryzer taps the screen and the Woman screams as she's electrocuted. After a few seconds, Pryzer ends the shocks and the Woman in Torture Room is panting]
She's going to Steel Harbor, the free city.
Do you mind telling me why Cora D. is going to Steel Harbor?
She's meeting members of the Resistance. They're giving her the retinal lenses, helping her out of the country, to Canada. She's with a freedom fighter named Axel.
Who has the retinal lenses now?
Krebs. William Krebs.
How are they getting out of the country?
She's had plastic surgery. Her face has changed. You won't recognize her. You'll never find her.
You're so beautiful. I'm sorry.
Colonel Pryzer, the Executive Counsil is on line two.
Tell him to hold.

[Colonel Pryzer touches the screen and the Woman in Torture Room screams as she's electrocuted. Two Guards turn up the power and the Woman arches her back up off the table as she screams. The Reflector Beam reaches its highest limit, the Woman in Torture Room screams and then the Woman drops onto the table, dead]
Put him on.
